title: I got out of honor 0 in 5 days.
body: In a little over a month i got two check points and am almost level 2 again.  I don't understand why people are taking so long to get out of honor level 0.

replies.body:
Let's not bump old threads as doing so is necromancy which violates the [**Board Universal Rules**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE).   While I understand this was bumped in an attempt to get Tantram's attention, that doesn't serve as a good reason to necro a thread.  I'm going to lock this thread down now.

If anyone has questions about this lock, feel free to reach out to the Moderation Team via:

* The [**NA Boards Discord**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification)
* The [**Discuss the Boards**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board

{{sticker:poppy-wink}}

When people receive valid reports, that aren't enough to trigger a penalty, it still affects their progression through the honor system. This is often times what creates the perception for honor 0 players that it takes forever to climb. They think that just because they are getting honored and not penalized, it must mean they are progressing. This is not so. 

We need to do a better job making progression visible.

Happy to hear that you are almost back to honor 2! Keep it up.

I am glad that (and maybe I'm wrong here) this is the first time that Riot has acknowledged that the *progression* isn't well conveyed to people. I'm not sure I'd say making any more signs of progress is necessary, but making it clear to people with low honor when they are not progressing and/or at least explaining that valid reports slow honor somewhere in client would be nice :)

Tell me about it. I am averaging 30-50 honors a day and haven't moved from 2 2/3 in over a month. No punishments or warnings, it just never moves lol. Weird that I'd be honored near every game, but am also being reported?

Keep in mind that honours from premades don't count as much as honours from non-premades, so if you are always with a group of 3/4/5 you most likely will not progress as fast as someone who gets the same amount of honours and never plays in a premade. It's also good to keep in mind that the system was designed to progress through over the course of a season, and thus a slow progression is to be expected.
I don't do premades, as a rule.  In fact my friends list has been empty since season 4 when my team quit lol.
I've been 2 2/3 since the start of season and not got a single checkpoint. I feel your pain.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-04-18T17:51:19.761+0000)

This is often times what creates the perception for honor 0 players that it takes forever to climb. They think that just because they are getting honored and not penalized, it must mean they are progressing. This is not so. 
> 
> We need to do a better job making progression visible.
> 
> Happy to hear that you are almost back to honor 2! Keep it up.

Honestly the honor system is very busted :/
Im playing for 4 months now im in honor 1 second level LOL...
Last season i got to honor 5 in 4 months... Its ridiculous

> Honestly the honor system is very busted :/
Im playing for 4 months now im in honor 1 second level LOL...
Last season i got to honor 5 in 4 months... Its ridiculous

It's supposed to take longer this season, since it's a full season (last season was a partial season). Honor 5 is a season long goal, not something you get in a week or 2.

You're honor 1 because you got penalized, so you were dropped down. You've also had a few hits to your honor gains since then.

I am trying to get myself back into honor level 2. I deserved the punishment I received a few weeks ago and I am trying my hardest to enjoy the game and be better as a person. I don't know where I am, I don't know how this honor system works, and I have a lot of questions about false reports and negative premades lowering my honor that I am trying to work very hard on.

I just got out of a game with a three premade group that blamed me relentlessly and attacked me the entire game because of me playing Rengar. I took the time to learn how to play this champion in bots and now I am turning over to normals to play against players. I am doing fine but when a Viktor and bot lane that is all part of the same premade are attacking me because they feed and cannot dodge a skill shot . . . and then they convince the Yorik to report me for inting . . . . what is going to happen to my honor that I have been trying so hard to work on?

I tell player GLHF beginning matches. Talk to my team. Say GJ and congratulate them on a good play. Be a good player and try my best. I still get flamed, I still get falsely reported, and I still get negative behavior. You rely so much on your community to be such amazing players but in reality you don't have systems in place to recognize players who are seriously trying to be better players. I mean I was doing my best in my last game and the past few games where I was trying my hardest to ignore the negativity from the premade. How can I do that when I have the premade and other player all falsely reporting me for things I am not doing wrong?

The punishment and honor system need an overhaul or massive adjustments. I want to see players who are creating drama and starting stuff removed and more harshly punished. I want to see my progression and where I am at with my honor. I don't want to be punished by a premade all reporting me for no reason to lower my honor. It's such a horrible system that I do not think is working as intended.

> I don't want to be punished by a premade all reporting me for no reason to lower my honor.

That doesn't happen. False reports have absolutely no effect on your honor.

I do see how it would be frustrating not knowing how you are progressing.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=00050001000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-18T19:31:08.457+0000)
>
> That doesn't happen. False reports have absolutely no effect on your honor.
> 
> I do see how it would be frustrating not knowing how you are progressing.

It does though.

You.. you realize you're talking to the guy who designed that system, right?

False reports do nothing.

> [{quoted}](name=Karunamon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=0005000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-19T13:51:54.910+0000)
>
> You.. you realize you're talking to the guy who designed that system, right?
> 
> False reports do nothing.

Yea, that is why I sent it to him. To let him know that we all know je is lying. Look at all the people who are posting on here getting banned for repeating what someone wrote. All of these are false reports, yet they are all banned awaiting manual reviews. These insta bannable manual reviews are the only ones going on. Do you seriously think there arent a million more less offensive false reports occuring with thier flawed system that never get manual reviews, that we never even knew occured? Come on now, quit blindly defending complete proven nonsense.

... you're *also* blindly defending people when you haven't seen the actual game chats and reports. That goes both ways. Only Riot has all the info, and while that may frustrate you or seem unfair, it doesn't change the facts. You can't actually absolve the people on the Boards who are claiming they were "falsely" banned. Without seeing the whole story, it's simply not possible to say it was a false ban.

> [{quoted}](name=KempyreanPirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=000500010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-19T14:33:32.608+0000)
>
> ... you're *also* blindly defending people when you haven't seen the actual game chats and reports. That goes both ways. Only Riot has all the info, and while that may frustrate you or seem unfair, it doesn't change the facts. You can't actually absolve the people on the Boards who are claiming they were "falsely" banned. Without seeing the whole story, it's simply not possible to say it was a false ban.

Oh wow, you are a member of Riot and respond in this manner!? So toxic. You didn't even read what I had wrote, this is a pure toxic emotional response here. You should be ashamed.

Lets go with facts here Mr. Slander. First off where did I say I was defending anyone? I have not in this post. Nothing I mentioned was "blindly" stated. The cases I was refering to in fact exist on these boards and in fact were resolved and deemed false by your bosses. It is all in print, nothing is made up Mr. Rude. If you truley care to educate yourself, and not simply be a toxic participant on the boards, I suggest you take the time, as I did, and unobjectivly read through some cases. 

I know even acknowledging someone like yourself is just feeding you, but seeing as how you hold a position of power in this company I didn't feel it right just letting you unjustifiably talk down and belittle people. I have screen shotted this conversation and suggest you begin thinking before you act. And even if I was just spewing nonsense and none of my statements were backed up by facts, which I assure you they are, you still have NO RIGHT to speak to someone as you have.

Well, I apologize if I offended. That was not my intent.

I do feel a need to reply and correct you, though, that I am not a member of Riot, merely the Volunteer Program for the Boards. I am not paid or employed by Riot.

Adding on to what KempyreanPirate said, cases where someone actually didn't do anything wrong when they got a ban are *incredibly* rare, and are usually one of the following kinds of problems:

* Someone said a zero-tolerance phrase, but was baited into it ("say kys kys or I feed", "what's the british word for cigarette") and reported. _(Note to those who might think this is a good idea: Don't do this. If you get caught, and it's very easy to get caught, you will lose your account immediately)_

* A scripting/botting suspension when the account was compromised (reversed quickly upon review)

* One single time where someone got a ban intended for someone else due to nearly identical player names

Bans for toxic chat use a type of chat filter, so unless left becomes right, up becomes down, and a three letter word somehow gets mangled into "kys" server side (the amount of memory and checksum errors that would have to happen for this to be a thing are astronomical - buy a lottery ticket, the odds are better), those suspensions are legit.

It's almost become a meme on this board for people to be presumed lying when they don't provide the chatlogs from their ban message, because there's *always* something they're not letting on without them. Show me all these chatlogs of these falsely banned players, and then we can talk about how the system is supposedly broken.

> [{quoted}](name=Karunamon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=000500010000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-04-19T14:44:57.133+0000)
>
> Adding on to what KempyreanPirate said, cases where someone actually didn't do anything wrong when they got a ban are *incredibly* rare, and are usually one of the following kinds of problems:
> 
> * Someone said a zero-tolerance phrase, but was baited into it ("say kys kys or I feed", "what's the british word for cigarette") and reported. _(Note to those who might think this is a good idea: Don't do this. If you get caught, and it's very easy to get caught, you will lose your account immediately)_
> 
> * A scripting/botting suspension when the account was compromised (reversed quickly upon review)
> 
> * One single time where someone got a ban intended for someone else due to nearly identical player names
> 
> Bans for toxic chat use a type of chat filter, so unless left becomes right, up becomes down, and a three letter word somehow gets mangled into "kys" server side (the amount of memory and checksum errors that would have to happen for this to be a thing are astronomical - buy a lottery ticket, the odds are better), those suspensions are legit.
> 
> It's almost become a meme on this board for people to be presumed lying when they don't provide the chatlogs from their ban message, because there's *always* something they're not letting on without them. Show me all these chatlogs of these falsely banned players, and then we can talk about how the system is supposedly broken.

First, lets get over this "link all the threads here proving your point because I don't feel like looking into it myself stuff." If you care to find some false positive report threads, easiest thing to do is look for the behavior threads Riot has responded to. They exist and are easy to find.

Now that we have that set aside lets discuss. I am refering only to false reports in regards to chat. I do not know anything about the other two you mentioned. Now think about what I am about to say. We both agree false bans happen, however rarely they occur. It does happen. I am going to guess we both know how bans and lowered honor happens, not by 1 single report but by many, unless they are those key zero tolerance words. And last, we know the report system is predominantly reviewed by a program and not manually. Which means it looks for whatever algorithms it was programmed to. 

My original statement that started all this was simply that "false reports do matter." in response to it being said they don't. Nothing more. Just that one statement. 

Now, it has been proven, evidence is right here in these boards. That false bans based off this programs misunderstanding of use of zero tolerance words do in fact happen, aka false reports. I do not see it logical to assume that the program does not make mistakes and doc points off lesser infractions on a daily basis. Aka, false reports do happen, and do effect honor since "positive negative reports" do effect honor. 

In summary, false reports DO effect honor.

>We both agree false bans happen, however rarely they occur. It does happen. I am going to guess we both know how bans and lowered honor happens, not by 1 single report but by many

You don't have a single shred of evidence to suggest number of reports has any impact on honor when they don't have an impact on anything else.

>Now think about what I am about to say. We both agree false bans happen, however rarely they occur. It does happen.

Fine, then **any such honor reductions happening falsely are equally rare as false bans** (And in no case is this reduction tied to the number of reports, which you haven't proven and there is ample evidence to suggest it doesn't work this way)

In this case it's easier, since player support will actually pull your chatlogs and give you an idea of what you're doing wrong. I've also seen many instances on this board, and wouldn't you know it - people aren't being as nice and non-toxic as they claimed to be.

Given that you think Riot is lying about how the system works (again, with no evidence), your position is unfalsifiable, and so incompatible with logic.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2018-04-18T19:03:15.586+0000)

No you dont understand...
I very well know that I had a penalty but there was a time before the penalty where i didnt climb at all-.-
I get that its a full season but honor in my opinion is something that is a side thing that gets players excited to climb and it shouldnt be something where we need to struggle our way through the way we struggle with ranking up...
Plus this has been the experience of players who havent been punished at all and they find it hard aswell...
Punished or not at the end of the day its a struggle and it shouldnt be

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-04-18T17:51:19.761+0000)

This is often times what creates the perception for honor 0 players that it takes forever to climb. They think that just because they are getting honored and not penalized, it must mean they are progressing. This is not so. 
> 
> We need to do a better job making progression visible.
> 
> Happy to hear that you are almost back to honor 2! Keep it up.

Could you please elaborate on this? Im stuck in honor lvl 0, checkpoint 1 for honor lvl 1. The most negative thing i said recently was that MF should have healed me and pinging the summoner. At least i think so, maybe im just lying to myself. 
Im just wondering how do valid reports look like that do not result into a punishment? 
Maybe im off, but in my opinion reports should only count as valid if they are enough for a punishment. 

But yeah, a progress level for the honor system would be awesome and maybe it could show me why im still stuck.

You really do. The system is soo tilting that after 4 months and 600 games  I'm still honor 2 checkpoint 2. I'm in that boat  where I get reports that are valid but never enough for any punishment. 

It's putting me off league knowing I'll never progress in honor levels because I'm sometimes passive aggressive.

@Riot Tantrum

For clarification purposes, can we infer that the honor system can be seen akin to ranked and lp gains and losses? Honors give you “honor lp” and reports take away “honor lp.” With this in mind it sounds like there is a possibility that an individual can actually go into negative numbers if they get reported when they are at level zero, Ian this correct? Lastly, is there any plans to implement something to deter individuals from false reports? As another summoner explained he wasn’t reported playing rengar by the premade. Yes, it is clear that there is no negative impact on false reports for the reported summoner but if there was an honor loss on those that falsely report others it may help minimize spiteful reporting overall.

I know that you think its a grind to make honor progress similar to level progress, with points, but it would be so good. First of all we could get negative points for valid reports which would be very helpful for us who are always on the edge of flaming to know when we crossed that line and offended someone. It would also help us see if we are actually progressing forward or backwards, I have been lvl 1 for just a few weeks but it feels like I am accomplishing nothing here and after the first week where I was super nice, I started getting tilted and light flaming again. I actually think that the system as it is is counterproductive.
Also for the love of god deal with the trolls like you do with chat abuse... Not to mention suicide  messages, sexism and racism. I have reported countless people only to see them playing the following day, those reports should be instant permaban, or at least 14 day ban.
Its a punishment.  It means you get no free chests or keys.

If you get punished, you drop down to honor 1, and if you get punished again, you hit honor 0. If you do something really bad that results in a 2 week ban the first time, you immediately go to honor 0.

There's no chat perma ban anymore - it follows this general line: https://tkwa.re/leaguereporttiers

wait wait wait what. on my account I got banned 14 day no warning and went to honor 0 for saying
"?
?

?"
I get honored nearly every match and play every day. I am still honor 0 check mark 3

?
?
?"

But that isn't the full story, is it?
{{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}}

You have absolutely nothing to worry about if you don't chat, or better yet, chat but not negatively.

I've never seen anyone get the hammer for ping spam (seriously though one is enough).

Isn't there something missing here?  Didn't there used to be a pop-up that would sometimes come up if you were in good standing but had a handful of recent reports warning you that you might be showing some toxicity?

Does that still happen?

there are tricks.  if you know them you get out faster.

same as knowing the tricks to not get sent to honor 0 in the first place.  just have to know the system
That's not true. There is no trick.
you are mistaken

Hamster you are literally famous on the player behavior boards for having no fucking clue what you're talking about and attemptong to back up your malinformation with out of context bull shit.  Go away.
I wouldn't use the word 'famous,' but they're definitely known to do this a lot.
my fans follow me around and downvote everything i say!  might not be famous but surely infamous

Not even infamous dude. I have to think about it pretty hard to remember you when I see a comment with your name on it. You disappear into the backdrop, especially when there are individuals who are far better than you at trolling.
nah you knew who i was.  no one knows who you are.  a generic clone of every other boards poster
The harder you try the more obvious it is just how far out of your depth you are XD seeya

hmm, can you please give out more details?

so a month ago you got banned (chat restricted, week ban?) and you were dropped to honor level 0 and you're almost honor level 2 in just a month? is that correct?

I got a ten game chat ban after two particularly tilting games.

The first was my whole team flaming the top lane Yas for doing bad, I defended him but talked too much, i shouldve jist told him to mute them.

The second was an intentional feeder, as in said he was going to and repeatedly ran straight to the enemy.(he blamed me because he didnt like my pick and one other person on my team blamed me too)
After talking with Riot i found out i was specifically banned for being overly argumentative when i could've muted and ignored him.  The inter got perma banned though.

I got a 10-game chat ban.

I played Arams to get through them.  This was a monday(26th of feb), that friday i had gotten honor 1.  In the middle pf the month i got a check point, and the other day i got a second one.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2dLK3IWP,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-04-16T18:50:14.879+0000)

Damn, then you must be lucky af 'cause i'm sitting here with my honor still locked (level 1) after 6 days of playing lol and getting atleast 1 honor every game.

Feelsbadman.
Honoring does more than getting honored.
yeah I honor every game, I never not use the honor system.

It isn't just about honors.  It is about being not toxic as well.  You may still be showing low to mild toxicity which is being acknowledged from reports but not severe enough to warrant a punishment.  You don't get told this is happening (which is not a good design IMO), but a riot post confirmed this is a common reason it takes people longer to unlock/climb from low honor levels than others.
Yes, I do know that piece of information.
